meanings.definition: A person or thing that follows or brings up the rear.
meanings.sent1: The footers of the group made sure no one got left behind.
meanings.sent2: The hikers walked in a line, with the footers watching out for stragglers.
meanings.sent3: The footers in the race decided to take a break and let others lead for a change.
meanings.sent4: She was always the footers in their adventures, ensuring everyone stayed together.
meanings.sent5: The footers of the team were like the guardians of the back, protecting the group from any surprises.

meanings.definition: A line of information placed at the bottom of a page for reference.
meanings.sent1: The report had footers with details about the sources used.
meanings.sent2: The book included footers with page numbers for easy navigation.
meanings.sent3: The footer at the end of the document contained important copyright information.
meanings.sent4: The footer on the webpage displayed the date of the last update.
meanings.sent5: The footer on the poster listed the event sponsors in small print at the bottom.

meanings.definition: A horizontal structural member at the base of a wall.
meanings.sent1: The builders reinforced the wall with sturdy footers to support its weight.
meanings.sent2: The architect included footers in the design to ensure the stability of the structure.
meanings.sent3: The footer at the base of the wall was painted to match the color of the bricks.
meanings.sent4: The footers of the building were hidden beneath the ground, providing a strong foundation.
meanings.sent5: The footers of the wall were like hidden pillars, holding up the entire structure.
